name: Portfolio 2.0
description: The website you are currently viewing. Instead of just updating my original portfolio, I decided to completely rebuild it from scratch using newly developed skills. It is my first time learning and implementing Tailwind CSS.

name: Full Stack Coursework
description: A summary of all the graded course projects I submitted during the UT Austin Full Stack Software Development Professional Certificate program (Oct 2024 â€“ Jul 2025).

name: Gardening App
description: A React-Redux application with selected vegetable and herb gardening resources, originally fetching data from external APIs. I then shifted to using a local JSON file. The current phase is refactoring for MongoDB integration.

name: WordPress Migration
description: A company website rebuilt in GoDaddy-hosted WordPress. After exploring custom theme development and Figma-based replication, I customized a base theme using Bootstrap Blocks, HTML, and CSS to match the original design and ensure full mobile responsiveness.

name: Webpage Replica
description: A copy of the Amazon homepage built from scratch with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

name: Portfolio 1.0
description: This was the first portfolio web page I created with HTML, CSS3, and JavaScript, originally based on a project tutorial during the IBM Introduction to Web Development course on edX.org. I changed the layout, contents, and style, adding buttons, icons, images, and fonts.

name: Calculator
description: A single-page website for metric to imperial unit conversion using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS3. I merged it with another project, a simple interest calculator.

name: Palindrome Checker
description: An application to solve different Java problems with a shared parser class. Currently offers a palindrome checking feature. The project is hosted on an online IDE for easy access.

name: Codewars Kata
description: Not a project per se, but the development of short Java programs to solve scenarios created by other users.
